# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `stroke`
* Variable label: `Stroke`
* Variable description: `Diagnosis of stroke or cerebral vascular disease since the last wave`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | NOT A stroke (cerebral vascular disease) 
1        | A stroke (cerebral vascular disease)

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `stroke_age`
* Variable label: `Age of each episode of stroke`
* Variable description: `Age of each episode of stroke`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "Stroke"
ds_label_age <- "Age of each episode of stroke"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
cont_label <- cat_label[3:11]
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process



## Finland


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `q4010_stroke` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Stroke`|
| **Table name**  | `Courage_Finland_w1`|
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes`<br/>`2 = No` |
| **Missings** | `NA`|
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign fin_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'COURAGE_fin_w1','Courage.Courage_Finland_w1',variables=list('q4010_stroke'), missings = T)
COURAGE_fin_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'COURAGE_fin_w1')

```

```{r local fin_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- COURAGE_fin_w1$q4010_stroke
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(COURAGE_fin_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(COURAGE_fin_w1, aes(x=factor(q4010_stroke))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `stroke` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `change 2 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

Age of diagnosis cannot be harmonized.

**R script:**

```{r harmo fin_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
COURAGE_ds_fin_w1 <- tibble(id=COURAGE_fin_w1$id)
COURAGE_ds_fin_w1$stroke <- car::recode(COURAGE_fin_w1$q4010_stroke, "2=0; NA=999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript fin_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- COURAGE_ds_fin_w1$stroke
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(COURAGE_ds_fin_w1, aes(x=factor(stroke))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation fin_w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(COURAGE_ds_fin_w1$stroke, useNA = "ifany")
BeforeH <- table(COURAGE_fin_w1$q4010_stroke, useNA = "ifany")[c(2,1,3)]
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("2->0","1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
rm(COURAGE_fin_w1)

```

### Wave 2

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `q4010_stroke_s1` |`age`|`yintw (pol_w1)`|`yintw (pol_w2)`|
|-|-|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `Stroke`|`age`|`year of interview`|`year of interview`|
| **Table name**  | `Courage_Poland_w2`|`age`|`yintw`|`yintw`|
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes`<br/>`2 = No` |`continuous`|`continuous`|`continuous`|
| **Missings** | `NA`|  |  |  |
| **Description** |  |  |  |  |

```{r assign pol_w2, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'COURAGE_pol_w2','Courage.Courage_Poland_w2',variables=list('q4010_stroke_s1'), missings = T)
COURAGE_pol_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'COURAGE_pol_w2')
load(paste0(datafolder,"pol_w2/age.RData"))
COURAGE_pol_w2 <- left_join(COURAGE_pol_w2,age, by="id")
load(paste0(datafolder,"pol_w1/yintw.RData"))
COURAGE_pol_w2 <- left_join(COURAGE_pol_w2,yintw, by="id")
names(COURAGE_pol_w2)[4] <- "yintw_pol_w1"
rm(yintw)
load(paste0(datafolder,"pol_w2/yintw.RData"))
COURAGE_pol_w2 <- left_join(COURAGE_pol_w2,yintw, by="id")
names(COURAGE_pol_w2)[5] <- "yintw_pol_w2"
rm(yintw)

```

```{r local pol_w2, echo=F}

vbl <- COURAGE_pol_w2$q4010_stroke_s1
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(COURAGE_pol_w2)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(COURAGE_pol_w2, aes(x=factor(q4010_stroke_s1))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- COURAGE_pol_w2$age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = names(COURAGE_pol_w2)[3])
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(COURAGE_pol_w2, aes(age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(15,95)

vbl <- COURAGE_pol_w2$yintw_pol_w1
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(COURAGE_pol_w2)[4])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(COURAGE_pol_w2, aes(x=factor(yintw_pol_w1))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- COURAGE_pol_w2$yintw_pol_w2
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(COURAGE_pol_w2)[5])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(COURAGE_pol_w2, aes(x=factor(yintw_pol_w2))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")


```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `stroke` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `change 2 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `stroke_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if stroke == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, stroke_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if stroke == 0, stroke_age = 996`
* `stroke == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo pol_w2}

COURAGE_pol_w2 <- left_join(COURAGE_pol_w2, COURAGE_ds_pol_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
COURAGE_ds_pol_w2 <- tibble(id=COURAGE_pol_w2$id)
COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke <- car::recode(COURAGE_pol_w2$q4010_stroke_s1,"2=0;NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke_age <- rep(999,length(COURAGE_pol_w2$id))
COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke_age[which(COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke == 0)] <- 996
COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke_age[which(COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke == 1 & COURAGE_pol_w2$stroke==0)] <- COURAGE_pol_w2$age[which(COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke == 1 & COURAGE_pol_w2$stroke==0)]-(COURAGE_pol_w2$yintw_pol_w2[which(COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke == 1 & COURAGE_pol_w2$stroke==0)]-COURAGE_pol_w2$yintw_pol_w1[which(COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke == 1 & COURAGE_pol_w2$stroke==0)])/2

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript pol_w2, echo=F}

vbl <- COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(COURAGE_ds_pol_w2, aes(x=factor(stroke))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke_age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(COURAGE_ds_pol_w2, aes(stroke_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(15,90)

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation pol_w2, echo=F, results='asis'}

AfterH <- table(COURAGE_ds_pol_w2$stroke, useNA = "ifany")
BeforeH <- table(COURAGE_pol_w2$q4010_stroke_s1, useNA = "ifany")[c(2,1,3)]
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("2->0","1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
rm(COURAGE_pol_w1)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `stroke` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `change 2 into 0`

* `if stroke == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, stroke_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if stroke == 0, stroke_age = 996`
* `stroke == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo spain_w2}

COURAGE_spain_w2 <- left_join(COURAGE_spain_w2, COURAGE_ds_spain_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization

COURAGE_ds_spain_w2$stroke_age <- rep(999,length(COURAGE_spain_w2$id))
COURAGE_ds_spain_w2$stroke_age[which(COURAGE_ds_spain_w2$stroke == 0)] <- 996
COURAGE_ds_spain_w2$stroke_age[which(COURAGE_ds_spain_w2$stroke == 1 & COURAGE_spain_w2$stroke==0 & COURAGE_spain_w2$age != 999)] <- COURAGE_spain_w2$age[which(COURAGE_ds_spain_w2$stroke == 1 & COURAGE_spain_w2$stroke==0 & COURAGE_spain_w2$age != 999)]-(COURAGE_spain_w2$yintw_spain_w2[which(COURAGE_ds_spain_w2$stroke == 1 & COURAGE_spain_w2$stroke==0 & COURAGE_spain_w2$age != 999)]-COURAGE_spain_w2$yintw_spain_w1[which(COURAGE_ds_spain_w2$stroke == 1 & COURAGE_spain_w2$stroke==0 & COURAGE_spain_w2$age != 999)])/2
```

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable by cohort:

**R script:**

```{r summ}

lb.hds <- list(fin_w1 = COURAGE_ds_fin_w1, pol_w1 = COURAGE_ds_pol_w1, spain_w1 = COURAGE_ds_spain_w1)
lf.hds <- list(pol_w2 = COURAGE_ds_pol_w2, spain_w2 = COURAGE_ds_spain_w2)

for(name in names(lb.hds)) {
  m_name <- paste0("COURAGE_m_ds_",name)
  aux_object <- lb.hds[[name]]
  label(lb.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  lb.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(lb.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}

for(name in names(lf.hds)) {
  m_name <- paste0("COURAGE_m_ds_",name)
  aux_object <- lf.hds[[name]]
  label(lf.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  lf.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(lf.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  label(lf.hds[[name]][[3]]) <- label(aux_object[[3]]) <- ds_label_age # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  lf.hds[[name]][[3]] <- labelled(lf.hds[[name]][[3]], labels = cont_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}

l.hds <- c(lb.hds,lf.hds)
ln.hds <- c("fin_w1","pol_w1","pol_w2","spain_w1","spain_w2")

t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][2])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
for (i in seq_along(ln.hds)){
  t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[ln.hds[i]]][2])[[1]][,4] 
}
t.hds[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(l.hds[["fin_w1"]][[2]]), length(l.hds[["pol_w1"]][[2]]) , length(l.hds[["pol_w2"]][[2]]), length(l.hds[["spain_w1"]][[2]]), length(l.hds[["spain_w2"]][[2]]))
names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label", "Finland_w1", "Poland_W1", "Poland_W2", "Spain_W1", "Spain_W2")
kable(t.hds)

```



# Quality estimation

No comments


<!--
Check the last claim of the first point of the next list with
frq(COURAGE_spain_w2$q4010_stroke_s1[which(COURAGE_spain_w2$stroke==1)])
2 individuals having answered Yes in w1 have No and other 87 are missing in w2
-->
* It is not clear that the data of the second waves for Poland and Spain corresponds to a stroke or cerebral vascular disease since the last wave. In fact, we can see in the questionnaire for Spain that if an individual has answered in wave 1 to have had a stroke, in wave 2 should be assigned the same answer (even the data does not agree with this too).
* Related to this, the study-specific variable `q4010a_s1` for the wave 2 of Spain asks for the age of the first time having suffered a stroke.
